label: Liturgy of Basil the Great and of the Presanctified Gifts

work_wit.alt_title: Liturgy of Basil the Great and of the Presanctified Gifts

note.value: The preserved sections from the Liturgy of Saint Basil come from the anaphora and the dismissal rite. A notable gap occurs between fol. 142v and fol. 145r: among other items, the epiclesis and intercessions for the living and the dead (diptychs) are missing. The beginning of the Liturgy of the Presanctified Gifts is found on fol. 146v, line 19

Bibliography: G. Rossetto, Greek Palimpsests at Saint Catherine's Monastery (Sinai): Three Euchologia as Case Studies, Vienna 2022 ; Arranz = M. Arranz, L’eucologio costantinopolitano agli inizi del secolo XI. Hagiasmatarion & Archieratikon (Rituale & Pontificale) con l’aggiunta del Leiturgikon (Messale). Rome 1996 ; Goar = J. Goar, Εὐχολόγιον sive Rituale Graecorum complectens ritus et ordines Divinae Liturgiae, officiorum, sacramentorum, consecrationum, benedictionum, funerum, orationum editio secunda expurgata et accuratior. Venice (Graz) 1730 (19602)
